result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew D Sawyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*If probation is revoked, huber priveleges for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow
*Jail sentence to be served on electronic home monitor if approved by jail administration and risk assessment - will need to serve the first 60 days in jail
Concurrent with: Concurrent with Count 3 and 15CM483 and Consecutive to 16CM335

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
*Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.

*No abusive contact with Mikela Lange
*Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Andrew Lehman 
*Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew D Sawyer in court with attorney Christopher G. Klingman. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CM483, 16CM123 and 16CM335.

11:01 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
State has complied with victim notification; no victim's appear in Court today.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CM483:
Count 1 - No contest 

16CM123:
Count 1 - No contest 
BTC:  Domestic Abuse Enhancer is stricken.
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - No contest 

16CM335:
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - No contest
Count 3 - DRI
Count 4 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 of 15CM483, guilty on Count 1 & 2 of 16CM123 and Count 2 is DRI and guilty on Count 1 & 2 of 16CM335 and Count 3 & 4 are DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Klingman makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CM483:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay 30 day jail sentence - consecutive to 16CM335 
If probation is revoked, huber priveleges for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow
Jail sentence to be served on electronic home monitor if approved by jail administration and risk assessment 
Placed on Probation for 18 months:
**Conditions of Probation are - 
Pay costs
Pay DNA surcharge
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
Comply with conditions in 16CM123
**Court will allow expungement if successfully completes all terms of probation and approved by the agent.

16CM123:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay 120 day jail sentence to run concurrent with Count 3 and 15CM483 and consecutive to 16CM335 
If probation is revoked, huber priveleges for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow
Jail sentence to be served on electronic home monitor if approved by jail administration and risk assessment - will need to serve the first 60 days in jail
Placed on Probation for 18 months - concurrent:
**Conditions of Probation are -
No abusive contact with Mikela Lange
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Andrew Lehman
Participate in any counseling and assessments as recommended by the agent, including domestic abuse counseling.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time. 
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 2 - DRI

Count 3 -
Impose/Stay 120 day jail sentence to run concurrent with Count 1 and 15CM483 and consecutive to 16CM335 
If probation is revoked, huber priveleges for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow
Jail sentence to be served on electronic home monitor if approved by jail administration and risk assessment - will need to serve the first 60 days in jail
Placed on Probation for 18 months - concurrent:
**Conditions of Probation are - 
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Comply with conditions in Count 1 

16CM335:
Count 1 -
20 day jail sentence concurrent with Count 2 
Jail credit of 2 days 
Jail sentence to be served on electronic home montor if approved by jail administration and risk assessment
Huber priveleges for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow
Jail sentence to commence within 60 days
Report to jail today for start date
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
60 days to pay or set up a payment plan 
Submit DNA sample

Count 2 -
20 day jail sentence concurrent with Count 1
Jail credit of 2 days 
Jail sentence to be served on electronic home montor if approved by jail administration and risk assessment
Huber priveleges for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow
Jail sentence to commence within 60 days
Report to jail today for start date
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
60 days to pay or set up a payment plan 
Submit DNA sample 

Count 3 - DRI
Count 4 - DRI

Defendant Matthew D Sawyer in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:01 AM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Matter is set for a plea hearing at this time.

16CM-123 Defendant has a new file, set for an initial appearance, there is an active warrant on it currently.
